title: Set uploaded image as static hero logo, display instantly without flash

requirements.summary: Replace backend-fetched logo with static asset reference in Hero and Header components to eliminate loading flash
acceptanceCriteria: The uploaded Kingston Customizations logo (cream background, dark brown crown and script) is visible in the Hero section immediately on page load.
No other image, placeholder, skeleton, or blank flash appears before the logo renders.
The logo is served from a static asset path (e.g., /assets/generated/logo.png) and does not depend on a backend fetch to display.
All other Hero component content (headline, tagline, layout, styling) remains unchanged.
The logo also does not flash in the Header component — if the Header previously used the backend-fetched logo, it should also reference the same static asset so it renders instantly.

file_operations.description: Save the uploaded Kingston Customizations logo image (IMG_2219.jpeg — cream background with dark brown crown and script lettering) as a static PNG asset at this path. This file will be served directly by the web server and loaded instantly without any backend fetch.

Remove the useGetLogoImage hook call and loading state. Replace the backend-fetched logo src with a direct reference to the static asset path '/assets/generated/logo.dim_512x512.png'. Keep all other content (headline, tagline, container styling, layout) unchanged. Ensure the img element loads the static asset immediately with no conditional rendering or placeholder.

Remove the useGetLogoImage hook call and loading state. Replace the backend-fetched logo src with a direct reference to the static asset path '/assets/generated/logo.dim_512x512.png'. Keep all other header functionality (scroll behavior, navigation links, admin dropdown) unchanged. Ensure the logo renders instantly on page load with no flash or placeholder.
